    Home

    Welcome to my homepage!

    I am a postdoctoral scholar in the Convective Systems/Tropical Dynamics Laboratory at the School of Earth and Environmental Sciences of Seoul National University in Seoul, South Korea. I am broadly interested in tropical meteorology, with particular interest in how tropical circulations couple to deep convection.

    I recieved my PhD in Atmospheric and Climate Science from the University of Washington under the supervision of Professors Peter Blosseyand Daehyun Kim (now at SNU). My dissertation investigated the dynamics of tropical convection precipitation at a range of scales, from individual convective systems to large-scale circulations.
